title: Large-Scale Simulation Training for Strengthening Scientific Information Utilization Skills in Academic Libraries

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary academic research skills, basic concepts of utilizing research materials, and understanding of the scientific inquiry process (observation, hypothesis formulation, experiment design)
context.additional_context: Cultivating the ability to utilize academic libraries' digital resources (scientific journals, experimental data archives) and data management systems (research reproducibility assurance protocols) to enhance research efficiency for science field professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can apply academic database search strategies in VR simulations for science domains with ≥80% accuracy, following variable control and hypothesis verification procedures.
Learners can consistently evaluate the credibility of academic materials using a reliability assessment framework (measurement metrics, evidence-based analysis) in ≥3 practice sessions.
Learners can execute and communicate ≥3 scientific information-sharing strategies (data visualization, experimental result interpretation) with peers in collaborative simulation environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
